markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Tamchal Chakram](/Weapons.aspx?ID=154)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Abomination Vaults</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Agile" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=170" />
<trait label="Deadly d6" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=174" />
<trait label="Finesse" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=179" />
<trait label="Thrown 20 feet" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=195" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil](/Sources.aspx?ID=75) pg. 73</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 5 gp

**Damage** 1d6 S

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Advanced

**Group** [Dart](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=6)
</row>

</column>

---

These circular weapons are among the many strange weapons used by [urdefhans](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=158). The sharp metal circle contains numerous protruding blades, while an angled central handle provides a decent grip that spins the weapon as it's thrown.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-6" />
name: Tamchal Chakram
